page.title: 11RELIGION IN BUTTERLEIGH
page.content: In Butterleigh village there is a Parish Church.There used to be a Methodist Chapel but it has now been converted to a private house (Capel Cottage).Baptists and Roman Catholics have to travel to Tiverton or Cullompton on Sundays for their Services. {ST.MATTHEW'S CHURCH} The font dates from the 12th century.The church was rebuilt in the 14th century and again in the 17th century. Inside there is a board showing names of Rectors,starting with 1277 when{Sir William De Frankehille} became Rector.There is also an 18th century {poor box}. The church hasn't got its own vicar so the vicar of Silverton takes one service a week on Sunday.The two parishes share a Parish Newsletter.
